text:
I work on the ANT-based build system for Forte for Java at Sun.  Some
people are trying to use ANT 1.4 (currently ANT 1.3 is the version
our official builds use).  Unfortunately some of our ANT scripts don't
work with ANT 1.4 because the behavior of Copy has changed: in ANT 1.3
it won't stop the build if you try to copy 1 file but the file doesn't
exist, but in ANT 1.4 it throws a BuildException.

I think that functionality changes like this should never be made
unless either the old behavior remains the default, or at least a
property or attribute can be used to restore the old behavior.  So
please make Copy look for a property that will stop it from throwing a
BuildException in this case, and/or (less preferable solution) add an
attribute to Copy to stop it from throwing the BuildException.
creator: jerry.huth@sun.com
jesse.glick@netbeans.com
text:
Perhaps the following could be a workaround?

<copy todir="todir">
    <fileset dir="fromdir" includes="fromfile.ext"/>
    <mapper type="merge" to="tofile.ext"/>
</copy>

(or similar)
Is the workaround suggested by Jesse good enough for you?
